title: Update steps
text: Follow steps: Run library(devtools) (optional?) Edit one files R/. Required ’ve made changes impact help files, NAMESPACE, collate order. Note check() won’t update NAMESPACE need run . Also, seems sometimes manually delete NAMESPACE file get recreated without errors. Note add/modify S3 methods, need run document() code fail run even load_all()!!! devtools::load_all() Run examples interactively. devtools::test() (test_active_file()) devtools::check() pkgdown::build_site(). get error “package named fedplot” need restart R beforehand (ctrl+shift+F10) see files available extdata:

title: How to create barplots
text: First, load ggplot2, fedplot (contains sample dataset FSR_2_4), scales. can construct barplot using standard ggplot2 functions:  Now customize :  Lastly, want export chart matches required dimensions image characteristics: exporting save_plot, chart looks like :
code: library(ggplot2) library(fedplot) #> Warning in load_fed_font(): Cannot load font 'ITCFranklinGothic LT BookCn'; not #> installed library(scales)  packageVersion("fedplot") #> [1] '0.6.0' head(FSR_2_4) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   date       risky_debt_type                value #>   <date>     <chr>                          <dbl> #> 1 2004-04-01 Institutional leveraged loans  15.6  #> 2 2004-04-01 High-yield and unrated bonds  -12.8  #> 3 2004-07-01 Institutional leveraged loans   6.33 #> 4 2004-07-01 High-yield and unrated bonds   -4.74 #> 5 2004-10-01 Institutional leveraged loans  20.9  #> 6 2004-10-01 High-yield and unrated bonds  -14.7 caption = "Source: Mergent, Fixed Income Securities Database; PitchBook Data, Leveraged Commentary & Data." FSR_2_4 |>   ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value, fill=risky_debt_type)) +   geom_col() +   labs(y="Billions of dollars") # , caption=caption) linewidth <- getOption("fedplot.linewidth_adj") * 0.25  FSR_2_4 |>   ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value, fill=risky_debt_type)) +   geom_col(color="black", linewidth=linewidth, width=60) + # Width is in days   labs(y="Billions of dollars") +   geom_hline_zero() +   scale_x_date(minor_breaks=seq(from=as.Date("2003-01-01"), to=as.Date("2023-01-01"), by="1 years"),                breaks=seq(from=as.Date("2004-06-30"), to=as.Date("2022-06-30"), by="3 years"),                date_labels="%Y",                expand=expansion(mult=.05)) +   scale_y_continuous(sec.axis = dup_axis(),                    breaks = seq(-60, 120, by=20),                    limits = c(-60, 120),                    expand = expansion(mult=0),                    labels = scales::label_number(style_negative = "minus")) +   #annotate_last_date() + # nudge_y = -3, nudge_x = 300) +   theme_fed(legend_position = c(.45, .7),             fill_palette=c("#DDCBA4", "#236192")) # + theme(legend.key.height = grid::unit(0.75, 'bigpts')) save_plot('barplot', size='wide', extension='all') #> saved 'barplot.pdf' (99x420; size=wide; dpi=300) #> saved 'barplot.eps' (99x420; size=wide; dpi=300) #> saved 'barplot.png' (99x420; size=wide; dpi=600)

title: How to create barplots
text: Legend symbols squares, rectangles height enlarged span line height. done purpose ggplot2 can changed custom legend functions. rule bar width? Note ’s set terms days absolute size. Add geom_col_fed function automatically sets required color (black) linewidth (0.25 times adjustment). Automatically use required color fill palette (needs determined).

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sergio Correia. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Correia S (2023). fedplot: Fed-style ggplot2 Theme. https://sergiocorreia.github.io/fedplot, https://github.com/sergiocorreia/fedplot.
code: @Manual{,   title = {fedplot: Fed-style ggplot2 Theme},   author = {Sergio Correia},   year = {2023},   note = {https://sergiocorreia.github.io/fedplot, https://github.com/sergiocorreia/fedplot}, }

title: Fed-style ggplot2 charts
text: R package allows users replicate Fed-style plots (e.g. FSR, Tealbook) within ggplot. contains theme several ggplot functions customize export figures. ’s currently work--progress (version 0.2), planned improvements including: Wrappers around options, less verbose (e.g. scale_* ). Documentation website. Better automated placement legend text labels. Better testing different OSes chart types. Document fonts options can changed options()

title: Fed-style ggplot2 charts
text: (Also see self-contained script)
code: library(fedplot)  ggplot(plotdata, aes(x = Date, y = value, group=source)) +   geom_recessions()   geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linewidth = getOption("fedplot.linewidth_adj"), linejoin = "mitre", lineend = "round") +   geom_line(aes(color=source, linewidth=source), na.rm = T, linejoin = "mitre", lineend = "round") +   labs(y = "12-month percent change") +   scale_x_date(minor_breaks=seq(from=as.Date("2003-01-01"), to=as.Date("2023-01-01"), by="1 years"),                breaks=seq(from=as.Date("2004-06-30"), to=as.Date("2023-06-30"), by="3 years"),                date_labels="%Y",                expand=expansion(mult=.05)) +   scale_y_continuous(sec.axis = dup_axis(),                      breaks = seq(-25, 25, by=5),                      limits = c(-25, 25),                      expand = expansion(mult=0),                      labels = scales::label_number(style_negative = "minus")) +   annotate_last_date(nudge_y = -3, nudge_x = 300)   theme_fed(legend_position = c(.8, .1))  save_plot('my-figure', size='narrow', extension='png')

title: Fed-style ggplot2 charts
text: install update fedplot:
code: ## Install current version from GitHub devtools::install_github("fedplot/fedplot", build_vignettes=FALSE)  ## Then load the package as you would any other library(fedplot)

title: Add frequency label — annotate_frequency
text: function annotates chart frequency used x-axis, placing text label top-left plot. automatically detects labels daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly annual frequencies. frequencies custom text strings, can use label argument.

title: Add frequency label — annotate_frequency
code: annotate_frequency(   label = "",   font_family = getOption("fedplot.font_family"),   font_size = getOption("fedplot.font_size") * 7L/8L )

title: Add frequency label — annotate_frequency
text: label Text added. equal "" "default", inferred based x-axis variable. font_family Font family. empty, default Franklin Gothic Condensed (unless "fedplot.font_family" option overwritten). font_size Font size. empty, default size 7 (unless "fedplot.font_size" option overwritten).

text: function annotates chart last date data available. looking first filtering missing values y-axis variable computing rows maximum x-axis variable.

title: Add last date of data — annotate_last_date
code: annotate_last_date(   font_family = getOption("fedplot.font_family"),   font_size = getOption("fedplot.font_size") * 7L/8L,   color = "black",   nudge_x = 0,   nudge_y = 0,   repel = FALSE,   box.padding = 0.25,   point.padding = 1e-06,   min.segment.length = 0.5,   arrow = NULL,   force = 1,   force_pull = 1,   max.time = 0.5,   max.iter = 10000,   max.overlaps = getOption("ggrepel.max.overlaps", default = 10),   xlim = c(NA, NA),   ylim = c(NA, NA),   direction = c("both", "y", "x"),   seed = 1234,   verbose = FALSE,   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   stat = "identity",   position = "identity",   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   text_aes = NULL,   ... )

title: Add last date of data — annotate_last_date
text: font_family Font family. empty, default Franklin Gothic Condensed (unless "fedplot.font_family" option overwritten). font_size Font size. empty, default size 7 (unless "fedplot.font_size" option overwritten). color Color text. Defaults black. nudge_x Manually nudge x-axis text. Alternative repel option. nudge_y Manually nudge y-axis text. Alternative repel option. repel set TRUE, try reposition text label avoid overlapping elements plot (lines). relies ggrepel::geom_text_repel() function ggrepel package. box.padding Amount padding around bounding box, unit number. Defaults 0.25. (Default unit lines, units can specified passing unit(x, "units")). point.padding Amount padding around labeled point, unit number. Defaults 0. (Default unit lines, units can specified passing unit(x, "units")). min.segment.length Skip drawing segments shorter , unit number. Defaults 0.5. (Default unit lines, units can specified passing unit(x, "units")). arrow specification arrow heads, created arrow force Force repulsion overlapping text labels. Defaults 1. force_pull Force attraction text label corresponding data point. Defaults 1. max.time Maximum number seconds try resolve overlaps. Defaults 0.5. max.iter Maximum number iterations try resolve overlaps. Defaults 10000. max.overlaps Exclude text labels overlap many things. Defaults 10. xlim, ylim Limits x y axes. Text labels constrained limits. default, text labels constrained entire plot area. direction "", "x", "y" -- direction adjust position labels seed Random seed passed set.seed. Defaults NA, means set.seed called. verbose TRUE, diagnostics repel algorithm printed mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes aes_. specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. need supply mapping mapping defined plot. data data frame. specified, overrides default data frame defined top level plot. stat statistical transformation use data layer, string. position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. na.rm FALSE (default), removes missing values warning.  TRUE silently removes missing values. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders. text_aes Named list, additional aesthetics send geometry. ... arguments passed layer.   three types arguments can use :  Aesthetics: set aesthetic fixed value, like        colour = "red" size = 3. arguments layer, example override       default stat associated layer. arguments passed stat.

title: Add last date of data — annotate_last_date
text: function formats last date string accordingly frequency publication standards. instance, monthly data gets formatted "Jan.", "Feb.", etc. exception June September appear "June" "Sept." respectively. Note formatting currently incomplete frequencies monthly.

what: Add recession bars to time series graphs — geom_recessions
title: Add recession bars to time series graphs — geom_recessions
text: geom_recessions adds shaded recession bars time-series ggplot2 chart (chart date object x-axis.) recession bars correspond NBER-dated recessions overlap date range chart. default, recession bar drawn light blue rectangle spanning entirety y-axis plus dark blue rectangle drawn topmost part chart.

title: Add recession bars to time series graphs — geom_recessions
code: geom_recessions(   fill = "#BDCFDE",   alpha = 1,   draw_top_bar = TRUE,   top_fill = "#236192",   top_alpha = 1,   method = c("midpoint", "trough", "peak") )

title: Add recession bars to time series graphs — geom_recessions
text: fill color main bar; defaults light blue tint. alpha alpha transparency main bar; defaults 1.0 (totally opaque). draw_top_bar Whether draw top bar . top_fill color top bar; defaults dark blue tint. top_alpha alpha transparency top blue bar; defaults 1.0 (totally opaque). method method interpretation used show recession data. Defaults midpoint method.

title: Add recession bars to time series graphs — geom_recessions
text: Internally, geom_recessions works adding GeomRecessions ggplot2::ggproto object, inherits ggplot2::Geom. replaces setup_data draw_panel methods order load recession data draw bars respectively. , actual drawing done two grid::rectGrob objects, main blue bar top dark blue bar.

title: Add recession bars to time series graphs — geom_recessions
text: function heavily inspired geom_recessions CMAPPLOT package.

what: Alternative methods used to show recession data
title: Add recession bars to time series graphs — geom_recessions
text: discussed St. Louis Fed FRED website (HTML version), multiple interpretations methods shading recessions. First, "midpoint" method shades peak trough months. used Fed Board St. Louis Fed publications. Second, "trough" method shades trough month peak month. used FRED graphs. Lastly, "peak" method shades peak month trough month.

Export figure — save_plot
text: Export figure

title: Export figure — save_plot
code: save_plot(   filename,   extension = c("pdf", "eps", "png", "all"),   path = NULL,   size = c("narrow", "wide", "box_narrow", "box_wide", "slides", "custom"),   scale = 1,   height = NULL,   width = NULL,   dpi = 300,   plot = ggplot2::last_plot(),   ... )

title: Export figure — save_plot
text: filename filename saved, excluding path extension. extension image extension; also defines type image. Valid values c('pdf', 'eps', 'png', ''); note '' create image types. path path file(s) saved size dimensions figure. instance, 'narrow' creates default figures 192x99 points. Valid values c('narrow', 'wide', 'box_narrow', 'box_wide', 'slides', 'custom'). Note 'slides' produce 192x161 figure, ideal two-pane Powerpoint slides. scale rescaling done ggplot2::ggsave; experimental. height height figure points (technically; bigpoints); useful size='custom'. width height figure points (technically; bigpoints); useful size='custom'. dpi dots per inch output file(s). Typical values 300 print (default) rarely 72 web image output. Note png images save_plot() multiples dpi 2, compensate lower quality compared vector formats (pdf, eps). Thus, default dpi png images 600. plot ggplot2 save. default save plot last printed screen. ... arguments passed graphics device function.

title: Position annual scales for date data (INCOMPLETE!) — scale_x_year

title: Position annual scales for date data (INCOMPLETE!) — scale_x_year

title: Fed-style ggplot theme — theme_fed
text: Fed-style ggplot theme

title: Fed-style ggplot theme — theme_fed
code: theme_fed(   font_family = getOption("fedplot.font_family"),   font_size = getOption("fedplot.font_size"),   legend_position = c(0.9, 0.1),   color_palette = "fsr_primary",   fill_palette = "fsr_primary",   linewidth_palette = "fsr_linewidths",   frequency = "default" )

title: Fed-style ggplot theme — theme_fed
text: font_family base font family font_size base font family size legend_position place legend; default c(.9, .1) color_palette color palette use (either string name vector) fill_palette fill palette use (either string name vector) linewidth_palette linewidth palette use (either string name vector) frequency string indicating date frequency; autodetected default
